Articles.Content:
in which order should i research the tech at career mode?

im done with tier 3, & i need advice about walkthrough for later levels.

should i choose Science Tech or General Construction?

Honestly, you should follow the bottom of the tech tree (Unless you are trying to make it harder for yourself) This will unlock a vast majority of the science equipment. Also don't forget to Visit different biomes and such (Minmus, the Mun and Kerbin all have biomes with their own science point pools) And don't forget to do EVA's and Crew reports (You can store one crew report per biome if you do it right)

Honestly, you should follow the bottom of the tech tree (Unless you are trying to make it harder for yourself) This will unlock a vast majority of the science equipment. Also don't forget to Visit different biomes and such (Minmus, the Mun and Kerbin all have biomes with their own science point pools) And don't forget to do EVA's and Crew reports (You can store one crew report per biome if you do it right)
so you saying to go on Science Tech?

theres no full walkthrough that says in which order i should research the tree to the finish?

so you saying to go on Science Tech?

theres no full walkthrough that says in which order i should research the tree to the finish?

Correct, and there is no walkthrough because each player is different. Like I'm currently not unlocking the next tier until I completely unlock the previous tier.

Correct, and there is no walkthrough because each player is different. Like I'm currently not unlocking the next tier until I completely unlock the previous tier.

JtPB, the above method works fairly well as far as getting what you need. General construction comes in handy in places, but Science tech is a better immediate return on investment. You can get lots more science much faster with the new instruments. General construction is better if you tend to overbuild missions. If you have launch clamps and some of the larger fuel tanks and the skipper engine, you have enough from there.

TL;DR, go science tech now, and you can fill out the rest of the tree faster. Going General construction will let you build bigger, but building bigger does not get you science any faster.
visiting the Mun & Minmus is enough to unlock all the tree? or should i do a little jump to Duna to complete the science points?

Go for braces, launch clamps, fuel lines, and oxstat solar panels as soon as possible. Don't even think of using probes until you have the Oxstat panels. Plan on recovering all flights for max science return. From there, the rest will come easy.

I had a similar issue as you, wondering..."What Next?"...and "How do I best get science to advance my tech tree?"... I found the following Tutorial/Walkthrough to be very helpful in getting me a lot more understanding of how to get science as well as helping me get to the Mun and other places. Check it out!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62814-Tutorial-Beginner-Science

I agree science tech is the best choice. However try to get the LVN atomic rocket moter as soon as possible. You will need it for going interplanetary
